intro: Craterostigma, commonly known as the "spoonleaf" or "spoonpod," is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or herbs, characterized by their unique, spoon-shaped pods that enclose their seeds. They are native to Australia and are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. Craterostigma species often have small, hairy leaves and produce yellow or white flowers. The genus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
